en: Get me the scissors, please.
zh: 请把剪刀拿给我。

en: The bazaar ended a great success.
zh: 义卖活动办得很成功。

en: Fill the bucket with water.
zh: 把桶装满水。

en: There's a hole in the bottom of the bucket.
zh: 桶底有个洞。

en: Empty the water out of the bucket.
zh: 把桶里的水倒了。

en: I'll get a bucket of water.
zh: 我去打桶水。

en: Bring me a bucket of water.
zh: 给我提桶水来。

en: There is little water in the bucket.
zh: 桶里没剩多少水了。

en: The bucket is full of water.
zh: 桶里装满了水。

en: Bacteria will not breed in alcohol.
zh: 酒精里不长细菌。

en: The new drug will be tested in Vaxgen's laboratory.
zh: 这种新药将在Vaxgen的实验室里进行测试。

en: Please put it on the scale.
zh: 请把它放在秤上。

en: Nobody but a fool would believe it.
zh: 只有傻子才会信。

en: It is neither more nor less than absurd.
zh: 这简直是荒唐透顶。

en: Stop your nonsense!

en: Don't be a fool.
zh: 别傻了。

en: Stop making a fool of yourself. Everyone is laughing at you.
zh: 别丢人现眼了，大家都在笑话你。

en: Don't talk nonsense!

en: Of all the silly ideas!

en: I'm ashamed because I acted foolishly.

en: Don't risk your neck over something foolish.
zh: 别为了这点蠢事去玩命。

en: Don't be absurd.
zh: 别太离谱了。

en: Prepare five postcard sized pieces of cardboard.
zh: 准备五张明信片大小的硬纸板。

en: Put this stamp on the postcard and drop it in the mailbox.
zh: 把这张邮票贴在明信片上，然后投进信箱。

en: A fly can walk on the ceiling.
zh: 苍蝇能在天花板上爬。

en: There are some flies on the wall.
zh: 墙上有几只苍蝇。

en: Flies and mosquitoes interfered with his meditation.
zh: 苍蝇和蚊子打断了他的冥想。

en: I caught sight of a fly escaping from the room.
zh: 我看见一只苍蝇从房间里飞出去了。

en: The fly is on the ceiling.
zh: 苍蝇在天花板上。

en: Do you like powder-snow skiing?

en: He is allergic to house dust.
zh: 他对灰尘过敏。

en: Will you have some more pie?

en: Yes, I know.

en: Yes, it hurts.
zh: 嗯，挺疼的。

en: Will you have another slice of pie?
zh: 要再来一块派吗？

en: "Will you have another slice of pie?" "Yes, please."
zh: “要再来一块派吗？”“好的，谢谢。”

en: Cut the pie into slices.
zh: 把派切成块。

en: Byron left England, never to return.
zh: 拜伦离开了英国，再也没回来。

en: Pilots communicate with the airport by radio.
zh: 飞行员通过无线电与机场联系。

en: The pilot landed the airplane in the field.
zh: 飞行员把飞机降落在田野里。

en: The pilot flew the airplane.
zh: 飞行员驾驶飞机。

en: The pilot explained to us why the landing was delayed.
zh: 飞行员向我们解释了为什么要延迟降落。

en: The pilot made a perfect three-point landing.
zh: 飞行员完成了一次完美的降落。

en: The pilot hinted that it might be a UFO.
zh: 飞行员暗示那可能是个不明飞行物。

en: The pilot described the scene in detail.
zh: 飞行员详细地描述了那个场景。

en: The pipe shop is across the street.
zh: 烟斗店就在马路对面。

en: The gentleman with his pipe in his mouth is a famous reviewer.
zh: 那个叼着烟斗的先生是一位著名的评论家。

en: Holmes is a great pipe man as well as a great detective.
zh: 福尔摩斯不仅是个伟大的侦探，还是个烟斗迷。

en: Something is stuck in the pipe.

en: You can hear the water dripping from the pipe.
zh: 能听见水从管子里滴下来的声音。

en: She got a run in her stocking when she broke the heel of her shoe.
zh: 她弄断鞋跟的时候，丝袜也勾丝了。

en: Would you like another helping of pie?
zh: 要再来一份派吗？

en: Acid fruits like pineapples and lemons are sour.
zh: 像菠萝和柠檬这种酸性水果都很酸。

en: I'm looking for a part-time job.
zh: 我在找兼职。

en: Yes, I like it very much.

en: Here it is.

en: Here's a magazine for you to read in the plane.
zh: 给你本杂志在飞机上读。

en: Shut the door behind you.

en: Close the door after you.
zh: 随手带上门。

en: Yes, that's the right answer.
zh: 对，这就是正确答案。

en: The hijackers moved to the rear of the plane.
zh: 劫机者走到了飞机的后部。

en: To prevent hijacks, all carry-on baggage is carefully inspected.
zh: 为了防止劫机，所有的手提行李都要经过仔细检查。

en: Can you set up the bike?
zh: 你能把自行车装好吗？

en: It can be dangerous for young people to ride motorcycles.
zh: 年轻人骑摩托车挺危险的。

en: I love biking and hard rock concerts.
zh: 我特别喜欢骑行和硬摇滚音乐会。

en: I got a motorbike cheap.
zh: 我买了一辆很便宜的摩托车。

en: Autumn is the best season for going on hikes.
zh: 秋天是徒步最好的季节。

en: We had better cancel the hike.
zh: 我们最好取消这次徒步。

en: The hiking was called off because of the rain.
zh: 因为下雨，徒步取消了。

en: Bring a lunch for our day of hiking.
zh: 徒步那天记得带份午餐。

en: It is said that the Vikings preceded Columbus in discovering America.
zh: 据说维京人比哥伦布更早发现美洲。

en: Every time we go hiking, he falls behind.
zh: 每次我们去徒步，他都会掉队。

en: Hikers need to carry a compass with them to find their way through the woods.
zh: 徒步的人需要带个指南针，好在林子里找路。

en: The violinist waits for the signal to play.
zh: 小提琴手在等开始演奏的信号。

en: Playing the violin requires much practice.
zh: 拉小提琴需要多多练习。

en: Who is the man playing the violin?
zh: 那个拉小提琴的人是谁？

en: The sound of the violin is very sweet.
zh: 小提琴的声音真好听。

en: Biotechnology will bring about a revolution in agriculture.
zh: 生物技术将给农业带来一场革命。

en: The accident took place on the highway.
zh: 事故发生在高速公路上。

en: Yes. He had just come home when I called.

en: Yes. I was very surprised at the news.
zh: 是的，听到那个消息我很惊讶。

en: Yes. We'll visit a factory which produces television sets.

en: Yes, and here's a photo of the farm where we milked the cows.

en: Yes. He can run 100 meters within twelve seconds.
zh: 是的，他百米跑能进12秒。

en: Yes, I spoke with the company president.

en: No, I'm not sleepy.

en: Yes, you must.

en: Here we are.
zh: 我们到了。

en: Yes, my name is Karen Smith.
zh: 是的，我叫凯伦·史密斯。

en: Yes, we have been friends since our childhood.
zh: 是的，我们从小就是朋友。

en: "Are the taxis being used?" "Yes, they are."
zh: “出租车都有人用吗？”“是的，都在用。”

en: Yes, I'm afraid so.
zh: 是的，恐怕是这样的。

en: Yes, I am from Sapporo.
zh: 是的，我来自札幌。

en: Okay, let's go.
zh: 好，我们走吧。

en: Yes, I have seen one many times.
zh: 是的，我见过很多次。

en: Sure. Right away.

en: Yes, Bob helped me.
zh: 是的，鲍勃帮了我。

en: Yes, he has already written it.
zh: 是的，他已经写好了。

en: Yes, but it'll be difficult.
zh: 是的，但这会很难。

en: Yes, I do. I answered.
zh: 是的，我回答了。

en: Yes, it has already started.
zh: 是的，已经开始了。

en: Yes, I am. Are you Mr Nakano?
zh: 是的，我是。你是中野先生吗？

en: Yes, I'm coming immediately.
zh: 好的，我马上过来。

en: Yes, I'm coming!
zh: 来了，来了！

en: Here is your appointment card.
zh: 这是您的预约卡。

en: Here are your keys.
zh: 这是你的钥匙。

en: Yeah, I'm going to take tomorrow off.
zh: 嗯，我打算明天请假。

en: Yes, two.
zh: 是的，两个。
给你10块钱。

en: Do you agree with Dr. Burns or Ms. Roland?

en: This guarantees me par.
zh: 这能保证我打出标准杆。

en: Doctor Burns, what should doctors do when a patient's brain is badly damaged?
zh: 伯恩斯医生，如果病人的大脑严重受损，医生该怎么办？

en: Is the harmonica a present from his father?
zh: 这口琴是他爸送的吗？

en: Now I have curly hair, because I had a perm.
zh: 我现在是卷发，因为我烫了头。

en: Can I have a single to Birmingham?

en: Do you want your permanent natural?

en: A permanent is extra.
zh: 烫发是额外收费的。

en: I'd like to make an appointment for a permanent.

en: Bourbon is made from corn.

en: Do you know a good specialty store dealing in herbs?
zh: 你知道哪儿有专门卖药草的好店吗？

en: What was the score at halftime?
zh: 半场结束时比分是多少？

en: Just make sure that credit is given: "from The Herbs, by Leon Thomas, published by Herbal Life."
zh: 只要确保注明出处就行：“摘自 Leon Thomas 所著、Herbal Life 出版的《药草》”。

en: Barbara's success is beyond question.
zh: 芭芭拉的成功是毫无疑问的。

en: Harvard University was founded in 1636.
zh: 哈佛大学建于1636年。

en: Bert doesn't go to high school, does he?
zh: 伯特没上高中，对吧？

en: The heart-shaped pond is the pride of the royal couple.
zh: 那个心形池塘是皇室夫妇的骄傲。

en: Part-time workers play an important role in the development of the economy.
zh: 兼职人员在经济发展中起着重要作用。

en: It looks like your hard disk is fragmented.
zh: 看起来你的硬盘碎片太多了。

en: When the bartender totals the bill for a customer who is drunk and angry, he must be very careful to mind his P's and Q's.
zh: 调酒师给喝醉又生气的客人结账时，必须非常注意言行。

en: Would you like to wait in the bar?
zh: 你想在酒吧里等吗？

en: How did the party go?
zh: 派对怎么样？

en: We did a lot of singing and dancing at the party.
zh: 我们在派对上又唱又跳的。

en: Party games bring a party to life.
zh: 派对游戏能活跃气氛。

en: When he got to the party, Sam made a bee line for the food.
zh: 一到派对，萨姆就直奔吃的去了。

en: I had to call off the party.

en: Let's get the party underway.
zh: 咱们开始派对吧。

en: Did you enjoy yourself at the party?
zh: 你在派对上玩得开心吗？

en: The party was a marked success.
zh: 派对办得非常成功。

en: The party opened with his speech.
zh: 派对以他的讲话开场。

en: The party was such a great success.
zh: 派对办得特别成功。

en: We called the party a great success.
zh: 我们觉得这次派对办得很成功。

en: The party went off beautifully.
zh: 派对进行得很顺利。

en: The party is over.
zh: 派对结束了。

en: The party was, on the whole, successful.
zh: 总的来说，派对办得挺成功。

en: The party ended with a speech by the host.
zh: 派对在主人的讲话中结束了。

en: The party was a failure.
zh: 派对办砸了。

en: The party is to be held next Sunday.
zh: 派对定在下周日举行。

en: The party went on for three hours.
zh: 派对持续了三个小时。

en: The party ended up with a chorus.
zh: 派对最后大家合唱了一首歌。

en: The party was fun. You should have come, too.
zh: 派对挺好玩的，你要是也来就好了。

en: The party was put off for a week.
zh: 派对推迟了一周。

en: The party was almost over.
zh: 派对快结束了。

en: A party is a good place to make friends with other people.
zh: 派对是结交新朋友的好地方。

en: The party was a lot of fun.
zh: 派对特别好玩。

en: The party is just beginning.
zh: 派对才刚开始。

en: I feel in my bones that the party will be a great success.
zh: 我直觉派对会办得非常成功。

en: The party ended up with great revelry.
zh: 派对在狂欢中结束了。

en: The party broke up late.
zh: 派对散得很晚。

en: When shall we have the party?
zh: 我们什么时候办派对？

en: How did you like the party?
zh: 你觉得那个派对怎么样？

en: The party was over at nine.
zh: 派对九点就散了。

en: The party was held on May 22.
zh: 派对是5月22号办的。

en: The party lasted more than three hours.
zh: 聚会开了三个多小时。

en: Are the party preparations okay?
zh: 聚会准备得怎么样了？

en: Each person's share of the expenses for the party is 4000 yen.
zh: 聚会每人分摊四千日元。

en: The date of the party is still up in the air.
zh: 聚会时间还没定呢。

en: At the party, one of his political opponents humiliated him in the presence of many guests.
zh: 在聚会上，他的一个政敌在这么多宾客面前让他丢了面子。

en: There was a lot of food left over from the party.
zh: 聚会剩了好多吃的。

en: Will you help me prepare for the party?
zh: 你能帮我准备一下聚会吗？

en: My brother saw to all the arrangements for the party.
zh: 聚会的所有事情都是我哥安排的。

en: I'll see to the arrangements for the party.
zh: 聚会的事我来安排吧。

en: He was still mumbling something about hospitals at the end of the party when he slipped on a piece of ice and broke his left leg.
zh: 聚会快结束的时候，他嘴里还念叨着医院的事，结果一脚踩在冰上，把左腿给摔断了。

en: I will leave everything about the party up to you.
zh: 聚会的事就全交给你了。

en: Emma was much in evidence during the party.
zh: 艾玛在聚会上表现得很活跃，到处都能看到她。

en: Will we be in time for the beginning of the party?
zh: 我们能赶上聚会开始吗？

en: I've mistakenly deleted the party information and registration you sent to me.
zh: 我不小心把你发的聚会信息和报名表给删了。

en: I'm very happy to hear about the party.
zh: 听说要办聚会我太开心了。

en: Are you coming to the party?
zh: 你来参加聚会吗？

en: Come to the party, will you?
zh: 来参加聚会吧，好吗？

en: Whoever wants to come to my party may come.
zh: 谁想来我的聚会都欢迎。

en: We will welcome whoever wants to come to the party.
zh: 只要是想来参加聚会的，我们都欢迎。

en: It's a hassle trying to decide what to wear to the party.
zh: 纠结聚会穿什么真是挺麻烦的。

en: He took a taxi so as not to be late for the party.
zh: 为了聚会不迟到，他打了个车。

en: Have you determined whom you will invite to the party?
zh: 你定好要请谁来参加聚会了吗？

en: Thank you for inviting me to the party.
zh: 谢谢你请我参加聚会。

en: Among the guests invited to the party were two foreign ladies.
zh: 受邀参加聚会的客人里有两位外国女士。

en: I am grateful to you for inviting me to the party.
zh: 非常感谢你邀请我来参加聚会。

en: He was present at the party.
zh: 他当时也在聚会上。

en: I haven't decided yet whether I will attend the party.
zh: 我还没决定好要不要去参加聚会。

en: I would admire to attend the party.
zh: 我真的很想去参加那个聚会。

en: I don't know whether to go to the party or not.
zh: 我不知道要不要去参加那个聚会。

en: You should polish your shoes before you go to the party.
zh: 你去参加聚会前应该把鞋擦一擦。

en: I would just as soon stay at home as go to the party.
zh: 我宁愿待在家里也不想去参加聚会。

en: Though I have decided to go to the party, I'm not looking forward to it.
zh: 虽然我决定去参加聚会了，但其实我并没怎么期待。

en: Don't you want to go to the party?
zh: 你不想去参加聚会吗？

en: You invited me to your party, but I can't make it this time.
zh: 你邀请我参加聚会，但我这次去不了。

en: Who was invited to the party?
zh: 聚会都请了谁啊？

en: I would like to come to your party.
zh: 我很想去参加你的聚会。

en: What are you going to wear to the party?
zh: 聚会你打算穿什么呀？

en: There was food and drink in abundance at the party.
zh: 聚会上有的是吃的喝的。

en: Which present shall I take to the party?
zh: 我带什么礼物去聚会好呢？

en: Only six people were present at the party.
zh: 聚会一共才来了六个人。

en: There were more than fifty girls at the party.
zh: 聚会上有五十多个女生。

en: Over 100 people were present at the party.
zh: 参加聚会的一共有100多个人。

en: I would like to express to you my deepest gratitude for having been a guest at your party.
zh: 真的很感谢你邀请我参加你的聚会。

en: Can you come to the party?
zh: 你能来参加聚会吗？

en: Don't bring any money to the party; just bring yourself.
zh: 聚会不用带钱，你人过来就行了。

en: Everybody at the party was charmed with her grace.
zh: 聚会上的每个人都被她优雅的举止迷住了。

en: We'll run into her at the party.
zh: 我们会在聚会上碰见她的。

en: I'll see to it that you meet her at the party.
zh: 我会安排你在聚会上和她见面的。

en: Please say hello to her if you see her at the party.
zh: 要是你在聚会上碰见她，记得帮我打个招呼。

en: I met my old friends by the dozens.
zh: 我一下子遇到了几十个老朋友。

en: The party puts everyone in high spirits.
zh: 派对让大家都很嗨。

en: Who will host the party?

en: I had a lot of fun at the party.
zh: 我在派对上玩得很开心。

en: At the party there was food in abundance.
zh: 派对上的吃的特别丰盛。

en: I hope you had a good time at the party.
zh: 希望你在派对上玩得开心。

en: What was served at the party?
zh: 派对上都有什么吃的？

en: Did you meet many interesting people at the party?
zh: 你在派对上遇到什么有趣的人了吗？

en: Everyone had a good time at the party.
zh: 大家在派对上都玩得很尽兴。

en: All the children sat up and behaved themselves at the party.
zh: 派对上所有的孩子都坐得端端正正，表现得很好。

en: Her behavior at the party was far from perfect.
zh: 她在派对上的表现远不够完美。

en: I am dissatisfied with his manners at the party.
zh: 我对他派对上的举止不太满意。

en: Please say hello to Nancy if you see her at the party.
zh: 要是你在派对上见到南希，替我跟她打个招呼。

en: A party will be held next Saturday, that is to say, on August 25th.
zh: 下周六会办个派对，也就是8月25号。

en: Love to party!
zh: 我就喜欢参加派对！

en: I just can't wait for the party.
zh: 我已经等不及想去派对啦。

en: By the time the party is over, dawn will be breaking.
zh: 等派对结束的时候，天都要亮了。

en: I'm looking forward to the party.
zh: 我很期待这次派对。

en: I don't see any point in going if the party is almost over.
zh: 派对都快结束了，我也没必要去了。

en: Hertz and Avis are head to head competitors in the car rental business.
zh: 赫兹和安飞士在租车行业是针锋相对的竞争对手。

en: Please put some candles on the birthday cake.

zh: 他的快球确实不错，但控球不太稳。

en: He was at the meeting, to be sure, but he was asleep.
zh: 他确实参加了会议，但在会上睡着了。

en: He is a nice person, to be sure, but not very clever.
zh: 他人确实很好，就是不太聪明。

en: He may still be young, but he really is a reliable person.
zh: 他可能还年轻，但真的是个很靠谱的人。

en: Indeed he is still young, but he is very prudent.
zh: 他确实还年轻，但做事非常谨慎。

en: It is true he is a learned man, but he lacks common sense.
zh: 他确实很有学问，但缺乏常识。

en: It is true that Mochida did his best, but he wasn't careful enough.
zh: 持田确实尽力了，但还是不够细心。

en: I may indeed be wrong.
zh: 我确实可能是错了。

en: Your plan sounds good, but the bottom line is: will it bring us more business?
zh: 你的计划听起来不错，但关键是：它能给我们带来更多生意吗？

en: It is true that yours is a good idea, but I am afraid it will be hard to put into practice.
zh: 你的主意确实不错，但我担心很难付诸实践。

en: It is true the boy is mischievous, but he is kind at heart.
zh: 这孩子确实调皮，但心肠挺好的。

en: It's true that the project is a difficult task, but Mr Hara will be able to bring it off.
zh: 这个项目确实很难，但原先生一定能搞定的。

en: So this is New York.
zh: 原来这就是纽约啊。

en: Indeed this car is small, but it is powerful.
zh: 这车确实小，但动力挺足的。

en: Indeed. He is young, but smart for his age.
zh: 确实，他虽然年轻，但在同龄人里算很聪明的。

en: It may, indeed, be a mistake.
zh: 这确实可能是一个错误。

en: Well, you may be right.
zh: 嗯，你可能说得对。

en: I'd like to come to see the doctor as soon as possible.
zh: 我想尽快去看医生。

en: I would appreciate a reply as soon as possible.
zh: 希望能尽快得到您的回复。

en: I would like the least expensive one.
zh: 我想要最便宜的那个。

en: May we ask you to remit in full settlement at your earliest convenience?
zh: 请您在方便时尽快全额汇款以结清款项。

en: Could you speak as slowly as possible?
zh: 您能说得尽量慢一点吗？

en: It's nice to drive on a smooth road.
zh: 在平坦的路上开车挺舒服的。

en: Do you think I was born yesterday?
zh: 你当我是三岁小孩吗？

en: He is a foreigner, as is evident from his accent.
zh: 听口音就知道他是外国人。

en: Judging from his accent, he must be from Osaka.
zh: 从口音听，他一定是大阪人。

en: You must not idle away.
zh: 你可不能就这样虚度光阴。

en: Success does not come from laziness.
zh: 成功可不是靠偷懒得来的。

en: He was scolded by his teacher for being lazy.
zh: 他因为偷懒被老师骂了。

en: Napoleon was a man of authority.
zh: 拿破仑是一个很有权威的人。

en: Napoleon marched his armies into Russia.
zh: 拿破仑率军进入了俄国。

en: Napoleon was exiled to St. Helena.
zh: 拿破仑被流放到了圣赫勒拿岛。

en: Napoleon was banished to Elba in 1814.
zh: 1814年，拿破仑被放逐到了厄尔巴岛。

en: Napoleon called the English a nation of shopkeepers.
zh: 拿破仑称英国人为“小店主之邦”。

en: Napoleon's army has advanced to Moscow.
zh: 拿破仑的军队已经推进到了莫斯科。

en: Napoleon's army lost the battle of Waterloo in 1815.
zh: 1815年，拿破仑的军队在滑铁卢战役中失败了。

en: Napoleon's army now advanced and a great battle begins.
zh: 拿破仑的军队开始推进，一场大战拉开了序幕。

en: Napoleon's life was a great drama.
zh: 拿破仑的一生极富戏剧性。

en: Had Napoleon been born in this century, what could he have done?
zh: 要是拿破仑出生在这个世纪，他能做出什么成就呢？

en: See Naples and then die.
zh: 看过那不勒斯，死而无憾。

en: Naples is a picturesque city.
zh: 那不勒斯是一座风景如画的城市。

en: What are some other nabemono?
zh: 还有哪些其他的锅料理？

en: What are nabemono like?
zh: 锅料理是什么样的？

en: Don't let the pan boil dry.
zh: 别把锅里的水烧干了。

en: The soup in the pot tasted very salty.
zh: 锅里的汤喝起来很咸。

en: May I have a napkin, please?
zh: 能给我一张餐巾纸吗？

en: Fold the napkins and put one by each plate.
zh: 把餐巾叠好，每个盘子旁边放一张。

en: Clean your lips with the napkin.
zh: 用餐巾纸擦擦嘴。

en: There is a napkin missing.
zh: 少了一张餐巾纸。

en: What are you crunching on?
zh: 你在嘎吱嘎吱嚼什么呢？

en: In doing anything, you must do your best.
zh: 无论做什么，都要尽力而为。

en: Above all, you must work now.
zh: 最重要的是，你现在得干活了。

en: Nothing will make up for his past mistakes.
zh: 什么都弥补不了他过去的错误。

en: There's nothing to do, so I may as well watch television.
zh: 反正也没事干，我还不如看会儿电视呢。

en: Everything is ready.
zh: 都准备好了。

en: Living as I do in a remote village, I seldom have visitors.
zh: 因为住在这么偏僻的村子里，我这儿很少有人来访。

en: What are you smirking at? Did something good happen?
zh: 你在那儿傻笑什么呢？有什么好事吗？

en: I'm still single.
zh: 我还是单身。

en: You were just listening to the talk, without thinking.
zh: 你刚才只是在听，根本没过脑子。

en: Is there anything I can do to help?
zh: 有什么我能帮忙的吗？

en: Let's find something to sit on.
zh: 咱们找个能坐的地方吧。

en: Do you have anything to say?
zh: 你有什么想说的吗？

en: Would you care for something to drink?
zh: 想喝点什么吗？

en: For better or worse, she will have the operation tomorrow.
zh: 不管怎样，她明天都要动手术了。

en: What's beside the desk?
zh: 书桌旁边是什么？

en: Do you know any Greek myths?
zh: 你知道什么希腊神话吗？
